intro: Erodium cicutarium subsp. jacquinianum, commonly known as the yellow field penny-cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring small, bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release tiny, winged seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
